Library.description: Come read story books at the library to kids aged 4-9 during our daily "storytime".
Library.name: Grapevine Library story time
Library.requirements: Must be a Grapevine citizen aged 13+

Parade.description: Come help with setting up this years annual Parade of Lights!
Parade.name: Grapevine Parade of Lights
Parade.requirements: Must be over 10 years old or accompanied by a parent or guardian. Also must be a Grapevine citizen

GrapevineTexasNorthPoleExpress.description: It’s the most wonderful time of the year!  We’re looking for a few elves to help create some Christmas magic at the 2022 North Pole Express®, presented by Great Wolf Lodge and Trinity Metro TEXRail.  We have a number of volunteer opportunities available and welcome both groups and individuals.  What do you need?  Closed-toed (elf approved) shoes, weather appropriate accessories (some activities are outdoors) and your holly, jolly Christmas spirit!  Santa thanks you in advance for your help!
GrapevineTexasNorthPoleExpress.name: Grapevine Texas North Pole Express

VolunteersinPoliceervice.description: Volunteers in Police Service (VIPS) can be an important part of any organization and have proven to be a valuable asset to law enforcement agencies. Since inception (2006), VIPS have been assigned specified tasks and duties that have created efficiencies for the department and improved services to the community. VIPS help to increase police responsiveness, service delivery, and information input, and they provide new program opportunities. In addition, VIPS can bring new skills and expertise to the job and prompt new enthusiasm. VIPS are intended to supplement and support, rather than supplant, sworn officers and civilian personnel.
VolunteersinPoliceervice.location: Grapevine City Hall, 200 S. Main Street, Grapevine, TX  76051
VolunteersinPoliceervice.name: Volunteers in Police Service
VolunteersinPoliceervice.requirements: 21 years of age and older and other requirements

VolunteerwithGRACE.description: GRACE offers many types of volunteer opportunities for individuals ages 16+ that can fit into anyone’s schedule. Our volunteers can get started with a simple 3-step process!
VolunteerwithGRACE.name: Volunteer with GRACE

Transportationforlocalseniors.description: Assist local seniors, ages 55 and up, by providing transportation to simple medical appointments.
Transportationforlocalseniors.name: Transportation for local seniors

TheRECExpress.description: The REC of Grapevine is looking for volunteers to drive our golf cart shuttle, The REC Express! This opportunity is easy and flexible. Drivers can sign up for 2 or 3-hour shifts, helping members get to The REC front doors. *Drivers must be 18 years old, have a valid Texas driver’s license and complete a short training. Email Patrick Dukes at pdukes@grapevinetexas.gov for all details and requirements. Once paperwork and background check is complete, Patrick will provide you with the password to access shifts. Please note: our emails to you may be blocked if you use a school-generated email address.
TheRECExpress.name: The RECExpress

TarrantAreaFoodBank.description: Come help organize food items and do quality control for Tarrant Area food bank.
TarrantAreaFoodBank.name: Tarrany Area Food Bank - Quality Control Theme Shift!

KeepFortWorthBeautiful.description: These flexible volunteer opportunities are for all individuals and groups who want to clean litter and have a positive impact on their community. They are also great for organizations who are looking for a day of service project. We provide free supplies to anyone cleaning litter in a public space in Fort Worth. All ages and abilities welcome!
KeepFortWorthBeautiful.name: Keep Fort Worth Beautiful

VolunteerwiththeFortWorthAnimalShelter.description: Want to make a difference? Join us! There are so many ways to volunteer your time to help Fort Worth Animal Care and Control(FWACC).We could not save more than 90 % of the pets who come through our doors annually without our incredible volunteer team.If you 're passionate about helping people and pets, we have a
VolunteerwiththeFortWorthAnimalShelter.name: Volunteer with the Fort Worth Animal Shelter!

TheMarqSouthlake.description: Here at The Marq, we utilize volunteers in a variety of different roles. From monitoring the Indoor Playground, sanitizing equipment, to helping at the Senior Activity Center, volunteers play a crucial role in the success of The Marq.
TheMarqSouthlake.name: Volunteer with Southlake Marq

SouthlakePublicLibrary.description: The Southlake Public Library provides an assortment of services and events for Southlake Residents. Volunteer to maintain materials and assist with various projects.
SouthlakePublicLibrary.name: Southlake Public Library

CityofSouthlakeTeenCourt.description: Teen Court is a 'hands on' educational opportunity which allows teen offenders and teen volunteers to better understand the justice system. Teen Court accepts teen and adult volunteers to serve as jurors, attorneys, monitors, and assistants.
CityofSouthlakeTeenCourt.name: Metroport Teen Court
